instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: hello, this board does not detect my wifi, I already tried with another wifi card, it remains, can you help me what measures to take for this damage

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: Machine detects another wifi networks, just your personal wifi not detected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message: does not detect any network, shows hardware not installed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
Check L3401/04 continuity.
Post <CHIP>U3440</CHIP> voltages, with wifi connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
l3401 pin1 a pin 2 there is continuity; pin3 pin 4 not continuity
mode dido pin 3 0.40 and pin 4 0.66 wifi connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no wifi
threads.message:
"pin3 pin 4 not continuity"
Make a bypass to fix it...
